thread.section_title: Broward County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Aquinas powers past rival Cardinal Gibbons
thread.title_full: Aquinas powers past rival Cardinal Gibbons - Sun Sentinel

author: Patrick Maks
title: Aquinas powers past rival Cardinal Gibbons
text:
St. Thomas Aquinas showed why it remains the volleyball team to beat in Broward County .
The defending 7A state champion Raiders (11-1, 2-0) won on the road Tuesday night to defeat Cardinal Gibbons in four sets, 25-23. 26-28, 25-21, and 25-17.
"That's our crosstown rival," Aquinas coach Lisa Zielinski said. "We play each other really hard."
Indeed, the crowded gymnasium at Cardinal Gibbons (10-3, 3-0) was filled with noisy fans. But Aquinas' steady play quieted the masses throughout the match.
After winning the first set, the Raiders built a comfortable cushion in the second and looked as if they might run away with the contest. But Cardinal Gibbons stormed back to even up the match.
"They definitely rallied," Zielinski said. "That potential was always there."
So St. Thomas Aquinas shifted its play into high gear as junior outside hitter Allison Marble and senior OH Brook Bauer dominated the game.
Marble finished with 16 kills, eight digs and two aces. Bauer had 15 kills, seven digs, one block and four service aces. Junior middle blocker Emma Dixon added seven kills, three blocks and three aces.
"I think they both really stepped up," Zielinski said of Marble and Bauer, noting Gibbons' strong defense.
But it wasn't enough to send the Raiders home with a loss.
The victory, Zielinski said, "gives us confidence going into the postseason."
St. Thomas next travels to Chicago, where they'll take on Mother McAuley on Friday in the Asics Challenge tournament. Cardinal Gibbons hosts Pine Crest on Thursday.
